p: The presence of an appropriate environment for the multiplication and growth of the vector mosquito, the wide distribution of mosquitoes in the Nile Valley and Delta with the absence of effective vector control programs that can interrupt the transmission cycle of the virus between arthropods and vertebrate hosts [ 2], and vertical transmission of the virus from female mosquitoes to their offspring. RVFV is transmitted by several species (more than 30 species) of mosquitoes that already present in Egypt [ 49].
